p: In this study in DRC, we aim to quantify the importance of four major arboviruses as a cause of acute undifferentiated fever. Furthermore, we aim to describe the case presentation and the presence of arbovirus/malaria co-infections, since Plasmodium falciparum is still responsible for an estimated 25 million cases nationwide–with 97% of the country being a ‘high transmission’ region, ranking DRC among the top 3 countries in sub-Saharan Africa with the highest malaria burden [ 30].
